channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Netflix shares fall after company reports profit miss
item.description: The company’s earnings came in below expectations, with the stage set for big gains with the company’s ad business in the fourth quarter.

item.title: ‘I’m furloughed due to the government shutdown’: Do I pull money from my Roth 401(k) or $450K home?
item.description: “I’m in my late 40s and I am a civilian employee who is reporting for duty but not getting paid.”

item.title: Here are 5 mounting risks that could hurt the S&P 500, according to BofA
item.description: Valuations are high, bear-market signposts are piling up, and companies are now contending with both tariff uncertainty and a data blackout.

item.title: ‘A friend calls it the everything bubble’: Why do so many economists fear a 1929-style crash?
item.description: We have faced fears, for more than 10 years, that the market is going to experience the kind of crash not seen in nearly a century.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
